rupture.translation[0].definitions[0].de: an occasion when something suddenly breaks apart or bursts
rupture.translation[0].definitions[0].ex: the rupture of a blood vessel
rupture.translation[0].definitions[1].de: a situation in which two countries, groups of people etc suddenly disagree and often end their relationship with each other
rupture.translation[0].definitions[1].ex: The eleventh century saw the formal rupture between East and West.
The rupture with his father was absolute.
rupture.translation[0].definitions[2].de: a medical condition in which an organ of the body, especially one near the abdomen, sticks out through the wall of muscle that normally surrounds it
rupture.translation[1].definitions[0].de: to break or burst, or to make something break or burst
rupture.translation[1].definitions[0].ex: The pipe will rupture at its weakest point.
His liver was ruptured when a brick wall collapsed on him.
rupture.translation[1].definitions[1].de: to damage good relations between people or a peaceful situation
rupture.translation[1].definitions[1].ex: The noise ruptured the tranquility of the afternoon.
